page.title: 05ADMINISTRATION AND MEDIA
page.content: Most homes have a radio and television set. Newspapers and Periodicals are delivered to the villages. A mobile library visits every two weeks. The first level of local government is the Parish Council, which meets annually and extraordinary meetings are called when necessary. South Oxfordshire District Council provides services such as housing, refuse collection, recreation, and environmental health. Oxfordshire County Council provides major services such as education, libraries, fire protection, social services and planning. A fortified bunker exists in the basement of Woodeaton School to enable local administration to continue in times of National Emergency. It is a comprehensive nuclear shelter.
